newsitem.title: DUBAI: Abu Dhabi firm gets 25-year free zone concession.
newsitem.headline: Abu Dhabi firm gets 25-year free zone concession.

text.p: Abu Dhabi's Saadiyat Free Zone Authority (AZH) said on Sunday it had awarded a newly founded company a 25-year concession to build and operate the $3.3 billon zone.

"The Project Development Company (PDC) will be capitalised with $3.3 billion of shareholders equity, a significant portion of which will be offered to domestic and international investors," said a statement by AZH, the state-owned regulatory body said.
It said PDC will offer shares locally and on the international market.
Nomura International will act as underwriter and global coordinator of the company's IPO which AZH said earlier it would be in September.

The zone, which will be built on the island of Saadiyat, east of Abu Dhabi city, will specialise in storage, transport and trading of commodities. The plan includes setting up trading floors and exchanges to deal in various stored goods.
